TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {9179=The Keccak Team made a presentation at NIST on February 6, 2013:, 11426=John Kelsey's November 1, 2013 email to the hash-forum listserv, 11828=NIST published a Federal Register Notice, FRN 2014-12336, on May 28, 2014 to announce the publication of Draft FIPS 202, SHA-3 Standard: Permutation-Based Hash and Extendable-Output Functions, and Draft Revision of the Applicability Clause of FIPS 180-4, Secure Hash Standard, and request for public comments. A 90-day public comment period is provided. Comments must be received by NIST on or before August 26, 2014 to be considered. Details for how to submit public comments are available in the FRN.}
textBeforeTable: NIST's SHA-3 Standardization plans were presented at the following events. Keccak and the SHA-3 Standardization The Keccak Team made a presentation at NIST on February 6, 2013: SHA-3 Standardization SHA-3 Standardization HASH Project > CT > Groups > CSRC Home > Contacts Hash Forum NIST Policy on Hash Functions SHA-3 2014 Workshop Federal Register Notice for SHA-3 Draft SHA-3 Standard (FIPS 202) SHA-3 Standardization (2013- ) SHA-3 Competition (2007-2012) Pre- SHA-3 Competition (2004-2007) Cryptographic Hash & SHA-3 Standard Development Events Archive Events News Archive News Federal Register Notices Archives Federal Register Notices news & events --> Federal Register Notices
textAfterTable: John Kelsey's November 1, 2013 email to the hash-forum listserv "Moving Forward with SHA-3" Draft FIPS 202, SHA-3 Standard: Permutation-Based Hash and Extendable-Output Functions NIST published a Federal Register Notice, FRN 2014-12336, on May 28, 2014 to announce the publication of Draft FIPS 202, SHA-3 Standard: Permutation-Based Hash and Extendable-Output Functions, and Draft Revision of the Applicability Clause of FIPS 180-4, Secure Hash Standard, and request for public comments. A 90-day public comment period is provided. Comments must be received by NIST on or before August 26, 2014 to be considered. Details for how to submit public comments are available in the FRN.   Hash Project Webmaster, Disclaimer Notice & Privacy Policy NIST is an Agency of the U.S. Department of Commerce Last updated: September 4, 2014 Page created: February 11, 2013
